claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote supports the claim by indicating that Flublok (RIV4) is not affected by mutations that occur during egg-based vaccine production, which can alter the antigenic match to WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains. This implies that Flublok maintains the intended antigenic match.
